sabotage.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to secretly damage or destroy equipment, vehicles etc that belong to an enemy or opponent, so that they cannot be used
sabotage.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Every single plane had been sabotaged.
sabotage.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to deliberately spoil someone’s plans because you do not want them to succeed
sabotage.translation[1].definitions[0].d: deliberate damage that is done to equipment, vehicles etc in order to prevent an enemy or opponent from using them
sabotage.translation[1].definitions[0].e: The terrorists were planning acts of sabotage to destabilize the country.
sabotage.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to secretly damage or destroy equipment, vehicles etc that belong to an enemy or opponent, so that they cannot be used
sabotage.translation[2].definitions[0].e: There are fears that striking workers may try to sabotage the plant.
sabotage.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to deliberately spoil someone’s plans because you do not want them to succeed
sabotage.translation[2].definitions[1].e: He’s trying to sabotage my career.
Why would anyone want to sabotage the deal?
